cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the lower Florida Keys, then north-northwest up the Florida west coast toward the panhandle and southwestern Georgia

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Fernandina Beach southward around the Florida peninsula to Indian Pass, including the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, Keys, and portions of the southeast U.S. coast up to South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–50 mph) with occasional gusts to near hurricane force are likely Sunday afternoon through Monday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels 2–4 ft above ground possible along the east-central Florida coast, including Port Canaveral, especially around high tide Sunday night to Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash flooding in the port region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, life-threatening rip currents, and a few tornadoes embedded in rainbands.
